ax.ha.it.smsalarm

Class LogHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ax.ha.it.smsalarm.LogHandler

  • public class LogHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for all logging. This means logging to LogCat, log.txt and alarms.html.
    LogHandler is a singleton.
    Since:
    2.0
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Robert Nyholm

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private LogHandler()
      Private constructor, is private due to it's singleton pattern.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void checkExternalStorageState()
      This method checks the state of external storage media and decides whether its available for reading and writing, only reading, only writing or not available at all.

      • logCat

        public void logCat(int priority,
          java.lang.String logTag,
          java.lang.String message)
        Method to create a LogCat log message. If no valid priority value are given it will log a message with ERROR priority with the origin log message and current error.
        Parameters:
        priority - Priority as integer see ://www.http://developer.android .com/reference/android/util/Log.html
        logTag - Log tag as string
        message - Log message
        See Also:
        LogHandler(), getInstance(), getASSERT(), getDEBUG(), getERROR(), getINFO(), getVERBOSE(), getWARN(), logCat(int, String, String, Throwable), logTxt(int, String, String), logCatTxt(int, String, String), logCatTxt(int, String, String, Throwable), checkExternalStorageState()

      • logCat

        public void logCat(int priority,
          java.lang.String logTag,
          java.lang.String message,
          java.lang.Throwable thr)
        Method to create a LogCat log message with throwable object If no valid priority value are given it will log a message with ERROR priority with the origin log message and current error.
        Parameters:
        priority - Priority as integer see ://www.http://developer.android .com/reference/android/util/Log.html
        logTag - Log tag as string
        message - Log message
        thr - Throwable object
        See Also:
        LogHandler(), getInstance(), getASSERT(), getDEBUG(), getERROR(), getINFO(), getVERBOSE(), getWARN(), logCat(int, String, String), logTxt(int, String, String), logCatTxt(int, String, String), logCatTxt(int, String, String, Throwable), checkExternalStorageState()

      • logTxt

        public void logTxt(int priority,
          java.lang.String logTag,
          java.lang.String message)
        Method to store a log message to file. If no valid priority value are given it will log a message with ERROR priority with the origin log message and current error.
        Throws different exceptions depending on error.
        Parameters:
        priority - Priority as integer see ://www.http://developer.android .com/reference/android/util/Log.html
        logTag - Log tag as string
        message - Log message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occur during file creation
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occur during writing to file
        See Also:
        LogHandler(), getInstance(), getASSERT(), getDEBUG(), getERROR(), getINFO(), getVERBOSE(), getWARN(), logCat(int, String, String), logCat(int, String, String, Throwable), logCatTxt(int, String, String), logCatTxt(int, String, String, Throwable), checkExternalStorageState()

      • logTxt

        public void logTxt(int priority,
          java.lang.String logTag,
          java.lang.String message,
          java.lang.Throwable thr)
        Method to store a log message and throwable to file. If no valid priority value are given it will log a message with ERROR priority with the origin log message and current error.
        Throws different exceptions depending on error.
        Parameters:
        priority - Priority as integer see ://www.http://developer.android .com/reference/android/util/Log.html
        logTag - Log tag as string
        message - Log message
        thr - Throwable object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occur during file creation
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occur during writing to file
        See Also:
        LogHandler(), getInstance(), getASSERT(), getDEBUG(), getERROR(), getINFO(), getVERBOSE(), getWARN(), logCat(int, String, String), logCat(int, String, String, Throwable), logCatTxt(int, String, String), logCatTxt(int, String, String, Throwable), checkExternalStorageState()

      • logCatTxt

        public void logCatTxt(int priority,
             java.lang.String logTag,
             java.lang.String message)
        Method to create a LogCat message, it also stores the same information to file.
        Parameters:
        priority - Priority as integer see ://www.http://developer.android .com/reference/android/util/Log.html
        logTag - Log tag as string
        message - Log message

        public void logCatTxt(int priority,
             java.lang.String logTag,
             java.lang.String message,
             java.lang.Throwable thr)
        Method to create a LogCat message with throwable, it also stores the same information to file.

        logTag - Log tag as string
        message - Log message
        thr - Throwable object

      • checkExternalStorageState

        private void checkExternalStorageState()
        This method checks the state of external storage media and decides whether its available for reading and writing, only reading, only writing or not available at all.
        See Also:
        LogHandler(), getInstance(), getASSERT(), getDEBUG(), getERROR(), getINFO(), getVERBOSE(), getWARN(), logCat(int, String, String), logCat(int, String, String, Throwable), logCatTxt(int, String, String), logCatTxt(int, String, String, Throwable), logTxt(int, String, String)
